result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaniel Booth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court "administratively" ordered credit given for 104 days time served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: * PAY restitution in the amount of $1,350.04 payable to the victim's mother, Kelly B. - To be paid over a period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

* No contact with the victim.
* No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 17 years EXCEPT court allows unsupervised contact with defendant's own daughter with the Probation Department's approval only.

* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with any other programming deemed appropriate by the Probation Department and follow any recommended treatment.

* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: with release privileges for treatment and employment purposes only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel Booth

records.addlTxt: Petition and Order for Funeral Pass; signed and filed.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED:  The petition is DENIED.
Bail refund packet
Bail refund packet
Notice and affidavit mailed to victim AND surety on 09/27/2016
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed by Atty. John Birdsall on behalf of the defendant.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form approved by Judge Donald and filed.

Defendant Nathaniel Booth in court with attorney John A Birdsall.  Defendant Nathaniel Booth in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State and defense counsel. Additional statements made by defendant's mother, Deborah F.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS. 
Court "administratively" ordered credit given for 104 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 5 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1 - AMENDED): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for treatment and employment purposes only.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with any other programming deemed appropriate by the Probation Department and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* No contact with the victim.
* No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 17 years EXCEPT court allows unsupervised contact with defendant's own daughter with the Probation Department's approval only.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $1,350.04 payable to the victim's mother, Kelly B. - to be paid over a period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
RESTITUTION WORKSHEET filed by ADA Erin Karshen on behalf of the State.
DEFENDANT'S SENTENCING DOCUMENTS - filed by Atty. John Birdsall on behalf of the defendant.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form; filed.

- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
- Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
filed by ADA Patrick Anderson for ADA Erin Karshen on behalf of the State.

- NO FILE IN COURT- 
Defendant Nathaniel Booth in court with attorney John A Birdsall.  Defendant Nathaniel Booth in custody.  Patrick J Anderson for Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State filed an Amended Information today.
Arraignment held.
Defense counsel waived reading of the "Amended Information" and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  3rd Degree Sexual Assault [a Class G FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.225(3), 939.50(3)(g).

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED):  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Case adjourned to 09-20-2016 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.
Clerk CANCELED the 11-07-2016 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Conditions of release remain the same as previously ordered IN ADDITION TO defendant is to be admitted to an outpatient drug treatment facility upon release.  $6,000.00 cash bail currently on deposit.  Defendant needs $15,000.00 cash bail posted for release.

Court ordered cash bail increased by an additional $15,000.00 for a total cash bail in the amount of $21,000.00 with TURNOVER to:  Justice Point Electronic (GPS) Monitoring for supervision. Court GRANTS request.

Case adjourned to 08-01-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Bail/Bond Hearing.

Defendant Nathaniel Booth in court with attorney John A Birdsall.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed conditions of release:  Defense motion to modify the conditions of bail argued and GRANTED.  Court MODIFIED the conditions of release to include the language that defendant is allowed to have "supervised" contact with his 10 month old daughter through a 3rd party.  Defendant's parents are approved to serve as said 3rd party contact.

Court addressed Justice Point violation:  Defendant received a violation for positive drug screen.  Arguments heard.  Court admonished defendant for receiving the violation and warned him that his release on bail is at stake.  Court did not modify bail or any other conditions of release at this time.

Defendant Nathaniel Booth in court with attorney John A Birdsall.    Student Intern Joshua Dryak for under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Gray Brown MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense motion to dismiss testimony of the officer.  Court denied motion.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathaniel Booth in court with attorney John A Birdsall.  Defendant Nathaniel Booth in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
